Description: Two joining sherds from shoulder of pottery closed vessel; near fine light brown clay with white inclusions; incised inscription on the outside.
Curator's comments: A. Johnston, Trademarks on Greek Vases (Warminster 1979) fig. 12c. The drachma signs follow the broken edge, indicating this was an ostracon, but the incomplete sign at the end of line 2 suggests it was originally larger. To judge merely from the lettering (alpha, gamma, rho) this will be a relatively early use of the drachma sign.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 18)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (NAU170, pl.35g)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2048)
